description: Psycho-Emotional — how you make meaning, regulate energy, seek repair, and signal desire in partnerships and shared experiences. Role-neutral, beginner-friendly.

questions.question_text: When plans change last-minute, I’m energized by adapting and discovering together.
I like to learn by trying small experiments instead of long discussions first.
When I feel curious with a partner, I’m most likely to…

choices.label: Propose a playful mini-mission right away
Set a tiny structure and then try it
Ask a meaning question to orient us
Make a decisive call to generate motion
Check comfort and pacing first

questions.question_text: A small intention or ritual can shift an ordinary moment into something meaningful for me.
I enjoy experiences that change my headspace (focus, trancey calm, symbolic frames).
When emotions swell, what helps me shift state fastest is…

choices.label: A quick grounding ritual (breath, touch, phrase)
Reframing the story together
A playful pattern-break
A crisp decision and clear next step
Tending to the setup or environment

questions.question_text: Consistency and warm steadiness are how I show love, especially under stress.
Even when stirred up, I can name limits and needs without disconnecting from care.
After intense moments, I’m most restored by…

choices.label: Firm grounding (pressure, weighted blanket, quiet)
Talking it through and reflecting
A gentle ritual (tea, music, candles, journaling)
A walk and playful banter
Tidying the space and restoring order

questions.question_text: I naturally spark energy with humor, dares, or momentum when the vibe dips.
Playfulness helps me reconnect more than long processing does (most of the time).
When I’m excited with a partner, I tend to express it first by…

choices.label: Teasing/flirting to build spark
Direct invitation with a clear plan
Crafting an aesthetic or vibe to set the stage
Sharing a feeling or image that points to meaning
Checking comfort and timing first

questions.question_text: Details matter: clear standards and presentation elevate my experience significantly.
I enjoy slowing down to refine technique—even if it means doing less, better.
When receiving feedback, the style that helps me most is…

choices.label: Precise, standard-based notes I can implement
Encouraging praise to keep momentum
Meaning-oriented reflections (what it opened up)
A playful nudge plus a quick fix

questions.question_text: I’m good at tracking emotions under the surface and naming them gently when it helps.
I prefer to understand the ‘why’ (values, meaning) before choosing a direction together.
In repair, my first move is usually to…

choices.label: Reflect back what I heard and check if I got it
Make a small ritual or gesture of care
Offer a precise fix or standard to align on
Spark levity so we can breathe and reset
Decide on one next step and move

questions.question_text: Under pressure, I’m comfortable taking the lead and setting a firm tempo for us to follow.
Clear calls and quick alignment feel kinder to me than lingering indecision (most of the time).
When someone I care about looks to me for direction, I tend to…

choices.label: Set a decisive plan and own the outcome
Co-create a plan but keep options open
Name an intention/why and follow the signal
Start playful, find momentum, then choose

questions.question_text: I can turn boring chores into a 90-second game (timer, mini-dare, victory pose).
If I spot an intriguing side street or odd museum, I’m tempted to detour—just to see what happens.
I keep a ‘just-in-case’ kit (snack, charger, band-aid, tissue) because it makes adventures feel safer and sweeter.
Crooked frames, wobbly tables, or mismatched glassware pull me out of the moment until I fix them.
I leave tiny notes or one-line ‘oracles’ for people—little reflections that land at the right time.
I have a go-to song, scent, or light trick that changes the room’s mood in under 30 seconds.
At crosswalks or crowded venues, I instinctively ‘shepherd the group’ and set a confident pace.
The snack tray / table setup that secretly delights me most is…

choices.label: Edges aligned, symmetry on point
Labels or color zones so everyone knows what’s what
A tiny ‘altar’ centerpiece (flower, candle, card)
Beat-the-timer plating challenge for fun
Surprise pairings and odd textures to explore

questions.question_text: When the group chat derails, my natural move is…

choices.label: Draft a clear plan with owners & next steps
Ask one orienting question that brings meaning back
Spin up a playful poll to regain momentum
Create a mini-doc / checklist everyone can edit
Gently name a boundary and suggest a pause
